div.p:
Feiere im April den Tag der Erde mit YouTube und erkunde zusammen mit deinen Lieblings-Creator*innen unseren unersetzlichen Planeten. Denn eines ist klar: Es gibt nichts Wertvolleres auf der Welt als unsere Erde.
Entdecke unter https://www.youtube.com/EarthDay jede Menge erstaunliche Orte mit: AsapSCIENCE Bretman Rock Cyrus North itsjinakim Jack Harries Jennelle Eliana Julia Gisella Lasizwe Dambuza Manual do Mundo Mark Vins MostlySane Nathaniel Drew Sailing La Vagabonde Slayy Point
Unter https://www.google.com/sustainability erfährst du, wie YouTube und Google ihre Kräfte zum Wohle unserer Erde bündeln.

entry.title: #youtubecoachellasweepstakes | Enter to win liftetime Coachella tickets from YouTube Shorts #Shorts

div.p:
Get your chance to win lifetime tickets to Coachella from YouTube Shorts. To enter, just create a Short telling us who your dream +1 would be if you won Coachella tickets for life, and use the hashtag #youtubecoachellasweepstakes. See full rules at the link below.
No purchase necessary. US only. 14+. Ends 4/30/22. See official rules here: yt.be/coachellasweeps

entry.title: Haley Elmhorst’s Story: Blazing a Trail for the Young Generation

div.p:
As a pre-teen, Haley Elmhorst fell in love with rabbits and started a YouTube channel to teach others how to care for them. After being diagnosed with a debilitating blood flow condition called POTS, she was forced to quit her job, but remained determined to start a successful online business selling rabbit care products. Today, the success of Haley’s YouTube channel has allowed her to open a brick-and-mortar store, where she sells rabbits, toys, food, and other products– while continuing to inspire the younger generation and those with disabilities. #YouTubeImpact
Check out Haley’s channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/101rabbits
Watch more stories like 101Rabbits: https://yt.be/USofYouTube

entry.title: Trenton & Heath’s Story: Inspiring a New Generation of Cobblers

div.p:
Driven by a lifelong passion for footwear, brothers Trent and Heath started a YouTube channel to preserve the lost art of cobbling and revitalize their shoe repair business. Today, their business makes six times more in annual revenue than before starting their channel, and they’ve hired seven employees to help ship shoes around the world– while inspiring other cobblers to keep the industry alive and reduce waste through shoe preservation. #YouTubeImpact
Check out Trenton & Heath’s channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/TrentonHeath
Watch more stories like Trenton & Heath: https://yt.be/USofYouTube
